byline.original: By AMY CHOZICK and TANZINA VEGA

abstract: Controversy over unorthodox circulation deal at European edition of Wall Street Journal may carry outsize influence among investors already concerned about ethical practices at company; publisher Andrew Langhoff resigns after an internal investigation revealed that the circulation deal also led to an agreement that provided Dutch company Executive Learning Partnership with two positive articles in exchange for its financial support.
snippet: The controversy this week over an unorthodox circulation deal at the European edition of The Wall Street Journal complicates matters for the company’s leadership.
lead_paragraph: The controversy this week over an unorthodox circulation deal at the European edition of The Wall Street Journal complicates matters for the company’s leadership.

headline.main: News Corp. Hits a Bump as Investors Prepare to Meet
headline.print_headline: News Corp. Hits a Bump as Investors Prepare to Meet
headline.seo: News Corp. Hits a Bump as Investors Prepare to Meet
